channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Purge'? Why Donald Trump's latest plan of 'one rough day' to end crime draws flak
item.description: ​In MSNBC's Morning Joe, the anchor suggested that Trump did suggest an hour of violence. "He did suggest there should be an hour of violence, which sounds like the plot of 'The Purge,' which is deeply dangerous. We know how his words have inspired violence before, including but not limited to January 6," Jonathan Lemire said. "His followers are hearing what he's saying," Lemire added.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump finds a fly on stage. Social media users say his reaction is not normal
item.description: ​MSNBC host and legal analyst Katie Phang said Trump's reaction to the fly was not normal. "Trump is exhausted and struggling to stay on track. He begins a story about a hat, but gets distracted by a fly and never finishes. He starts a entirely new story and struggles with the word "unique"," X handle American Bridge 21st Century posted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 193 dead, several missing after heavy rainfall triggers floods in Nepal; Top developments
item.description: Nepal's floods and landslides have resulted in 193 deaths, with many still missing. Southern Kathmandu is among the worst-hit areas. Authorities are intensifying rescue efforts and constructing temporary shelters for displaced residents. Northern Bangladesh also faces severe flooding, impacting thousands due to rising water levels.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UAE condemns 'heinous' attack on ambassador's home in Sudan
item.description: The UAE has condemned an attack on its ambassador's residence in Sudan, blaming the Sudanese army for extensive damage. The army denied targeting diplomatic missions and accused the RSF of such actions. Heavy clashes continue in Khartoum as both sides trade accusations. The UAE denies supporting the RSF, emphasizing its humanitarian efforts.

item.title: Nepal begins damage assessment as devastating floods claim 192 lives
item.description: Nepal is currently assessing the damage from devastating floods and landslides that resulted in 200 deaths and left 32 people missing. Triggered by a low-pressure system in the Bay of Bengal, heavy rains severely affected Kathmandu Valley and northern Bangladesh. Experts blame poor urban planning and climate change for worsening the disaster's impact.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nepal's urban poor count cost of 'nightmare' floods
item.description: Floods in Kathmandu have severely impacted the city's poorest residents, with the Bagmati river overflowing due to heavy rains. Nearly 200 people were killed, and many remain missing. Rescue teams are working tirelessly to clear debris and provide relief. Experts attribute the increasing frequency and severity of such events to climate change.

item.title: Iran executes two men in public over deadly armed robbery
item.description: Shigeru Ishiba, recently elected as the leader of Japan's Liberal Democratic Party, intends to call a parliamentary election on Oct. 27 after assuming the role of prime minister. He focuses on reinforcing national security and continuing economic policies while tackling issues like declining birthrate. Key defense experts are anticipated in his Cabinet.

item.title: EU to continue China electric vehicle talks even after final vote, say sources
item.description: The European Commission intends to keep negotiating with China over electric vehicle tariffs even after EU nations vote on final import duties this Friday. Proposed tariffs range from 7.8 per cent to 35.3 per cent, depending on company cooperation, and would be in addition to the standard 10% car import duty.

item.title: 'To hold general election on October 27': Japan's next PM Shigeru Ishiba
item.description: Shigeru Ishiba, poised to be Japan's next prime minister, intends to call a parliamentary election on October 27 after his formal election. Chosen as the leader of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party last Friday, he succeeds Fumio Kishida. With the LDP holding a majority in parliament, Ishiba's election is certain.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hassan Nasrallah to Nabil Kaouk: 7 Hezbollah commanders killed in Israeli strikes in 7 days
item.description: Israel has significantly escalated its actions against Hezbollah by killing seven top commanders, including leader Hassan Nasrallah. This move follows Hezbollah's alliance with Hamas in Gaza. The deaths present a major challenge for the organization. The group's Shura Council is expected to meet soon to select new leadership.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'My crowds are pretty big': Kamala Harris mocks Trump during fundraiser
item.description: Kamala Harris targeted Donald Trump at a fundraiser, boasting about her campaign's large crowds and addressing immigration in key states like Arizona and Nevada. She dismissed Trump's criticisms while gaining support from some Republicans. Harris also promised to eliminate federal taxes on tips for service workers, emphasizing the close race to the White House.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs taken 'off suicide watch' as court trial looms
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs is no longer under intensive monitoring at Brooklyn's detention center where he faces sexual assault and prostitution charges. Despite being denied bail twice, including a $50 million offer, Combs remains focused on his legal defense. His family has surrendered their passports to support his claim of not being a flight risk.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania Trump reveals her son Barron Trump's living situation in college
item.description: Melania Trump shared that her son Barron is residing at the family's Trump Tower home while attending New York University. She respects his decision to live in New York and hopes he enjoys his college experience. Barron, a recent Oxbridge Academy graduate, is enrolled at NYU's Stern School of Business.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Could an all-out war in the Middle East be avoided? What Biden said
item.description: US President Joe Biden has urged for efforts to prevent an all-out war in the Middle East amid rising tensions between Israel and Hezbollah. Following Israeli airstrikes that killed Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah, Biden expressed worries about potential involvement from Iran and the US. He plans to communicate with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu soon.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Is mathematics the path to AI chatbots that don’t make stuff up?
Cash-strapped Pakistan cuts 150,000 jobs, dissolves 6 ministries as part of IMF deal
Israel's Netanyahu adds rival to Cabinet, strengthens hold on office
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has expanded his coalition by appointing former rival Gideon Saar to his Cabinet as a minister without portfolio. Saar will also serve in the Security Cabinet. This strategic appointment aims to fortify Netanyahu's position amid significant political challenges, including budget passage and military draft issues, while reducing ultranationalist influence.

item.title: US President Biden to visit Hurricane Helene-affected areas amid ongoing recovery efforts
item.description: President Joe Biden plans to visit areas hit by Hurricane Helene, ensuring it won't disrupt rescue efforts. He assured state officials of continued federal support as the storm's death toll reaches at least 84 across several states. Former President Donald Trump will also visit Georgia for damage assessment and relief distribution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: War intensifies in Middle East as Israel hit Beirut city for first time, also struck Houthis in Yemen
item.description: An Israeli airstrike targeted an apartment building in Beirut, killing at least two people and heightening regional tensions. This incident follows recent strikes on Hezbollah and Houthi positions. Over 1,000 Lebanese have died recently, with a million displaced. The US is advocating for diplomatic resolutions to avoid further conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nasa astronauts receive new ride home as SpaceX Dragon capsule arrives at ISS
item.description: Two astronauts stuck on the ISS since June finally got their return transport through a SpaceX capsule after NASA deemed Boeing's Starliner unsafe due to thruster failures and helium leaks. The Dragon capsule will remain docked until February, while NASA continues inspecting the Starliner.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
